body_html: Hi @anjany, unfortunately not. I also had no time to contribute. You may try to create a work around that works for your exact case using the tf.pad() function, which supports different types of padding: https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/pad
body_text: Hi @anjany, unfortunately not. I also had no time to contribute. You may try to create a work around that works for your exact case using the tf.pad() function, which supports different types of padding: https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/pad
body: Hi @anjany, unfortunately not. I also had no time to contribute. You may try to create a work around that works for your exact case using the `tf.pad()` function, which supports different types of padding: https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/pad
